channel.title: From Scratch on DomsDev Data-Science
channel.description: Recent content in From Scratch on DomsDev Data-Science

item.title: Building a Neural Network from scratch
item.description:
Objective:

The goal here is to deal with the XOr classification problem that can’t be solved with classical logistic regression models. The XOr, or “exclusive or” problem is a classic problem that can be solved with Artificial Neural Network to predict the outputs of XOr logic gates given two binary inputs. The XOr function returns a true value if the two inputs are not equal and a false value if they are equal.

I will apply a such ANN built from scratch to a custom dataset generated for XOr binary classification.

item.title: Multiple and Polynomial Regression from scratch
item.description:
Objective:

The goal is to create median house price estimator for Boston city, using a Multiple Linear Regression Model build from scratch, applied on the “Boston Housing Dataset”. Then I will try to improve this estimator, using a Multiple Polynomial Regression Model.

I won’t explain theory here, only background basic equations needed for code understanding.

item.title: A Simple Linear Regression from scratch
item.description:
Objective:

The goal is to create a salary estimator based on years of experience of the employees of an anonymous company, using a simple Linear Regression Model build from scratch applied on “Salary_Data.csv” Kaggle’s dataset. Then I will compare the performance of the model against the prebuilt Sklearn linear regression model.

I won’t explain theory here, only background basic equations needed for code understanding.
